    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • validPrevious

        public static boolean validPrevious​(java.lang.String prev)
        Determines if a the previous input correspond to a pawn double move.
        Parameters:
        prev - The previous input from the current one.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if the previous input correspond to a pawn double move, false otherwise.

      • validateMove

        public static boolean validateMove​(int[] origin,
                                   int[] destination,
                                   java.lang.String input,
                                   boolean whitesMove)
        Determines if a given move is valid by checking if that particular piece can move at that location, the given situation supports it, and it does not leave their king in check.
        Parameters:
        origin - Where the piece is currently located in the board via board index.
        destination - Where the piece wants to go in the board via board index.
        input - The user input used for pawn promotion.
        whitesMove - True if the current move is white's, false otherwise
        Returns:
        True if the given move is valid, false otherwise.

      • checkCollisions

        public static boolean checkCollisions​(int[] origin,
                                      int[] destination,
                                      int[][] moves)
        Determines if there is a piece in the way of a given move.
        Parameters:
        origin - Where the piece is currently located in the board via board index.
        destination - Where the piece wants to go in the board via board index.
        moves - A 2d array of every possible move a Queen/Bishop/Rook can make.
        Returns:
        Returns true if there is a collision on the way of a move, false otherwise.

      • checkMove

        public static boolean checkMove​(int[] origin,
                                int[] destination,
                                int[][] moves)
        Determines if a given move is valid by checking matching the destination with the origin plus a particular move.
        Parameters:
        origin - Where the piece is currently located in the board via board index.
        destination - Where the piece wants to go in the board via board index.
        moves - A 2d array of every possible move that piece can make.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the given move is reachable and valid, false otherwise.

      • movePiece

        public static void movePiece​(int[] origin,
                             int[] destination,
                             Tile piece,
                             Tile target)
        Given where the piece that wants to move is located, it swaps tiles with tile located at the destination. If an enemy piece is located there, captures it.
        Parameters:
        origin - Where the piece is currently located in the board via board index.
        destination - Where the piece wants to go in the board via board index.
        piece - The piece that wants to move.
        target - The enemy piece that piece wants to attack or the tile that the piece wants to move to.

      • reverseMove

        public static void reverseMove​(int[] origin,
                               int[] destination,
                               Tile piece,
                               Tile target)
        Reverses the move a piece most recently made on the board.
        Parameters:
        origin - Where the piece was located in the board via board index.
        destination - Where the piece is currently located in the board via board index.
        piece - The piece that recently moved.
        target - The enemy piece that the piece attacked or the tile object that the piece swapped places with.

      • reverseCastle

        public static void reverseCastle​(int[] origin,
                                 java.lang.String team)
        Reverse the castle a king most recently made on the board.
        Parameters:
        origin - Where the king was located in the board via board index.
        team - What team the king sides with.

      • pawnPromotion

        public static Tile pawnPromotion​(java.lang.String input,
                                 java.lang.String team)
        Given the most recent user input and team of the piece, returns the piece object of what the user wants the pawn to promote into.
        Parameters:
        input - The user input.
        team - What team the user resides with.
        Returns:
        Returns the new Tile object that pawn promoted to.

      • validCastling

        public static boolean validCastling()
        Determines if a King is currently in the right situation to perform a castle.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a King can do a castle, otherwise false.

      • checksOwnKing

        public static boolean checksOwnKing​(java.lang.String team)
        Determines if the most recent move leaves the given team's King in check.
        Parameters:
        team - Either "white" or "black" depending on what team the current user resides with.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the recent move leaves their own King in check, false otherwise.

      • check

        public static void check()
        Updates global variables whiteCheck and blackCheck on how many pieces is currently checking the White King or Black King respectively.

      • checkmate

        public static boolean checkmate​(java.lang.String team)
        Determines if a certain team's king is in check mate.
        Parameters:
        team - Either "white" or "black" corresponding to that color's king
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if a team's king is in check mate, false otherwise.

      • checkInput

        public static boolean checkInput​(java.lang.String input)
        Checks if a certain input is properly formatted.
        Parameters:
        input - User input.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if input if properly formatted, false otherwise.

      • getIndex

        public static int[] getIndex​(java.lang.String input)
        Returns the board index of a given input.
        Parameters:
        input - Substring of the original user input of length 2.
        Returns:
        int[] Index of the input in terms of the board.

      • initBoard

        public static void initBoard()
        Initializes the board at the start of the program.

      • printBoard

        public static void printBoard()
        Prints the board at the current state.
